description: Borrowed from Russian ба́бушка (bábuška, “grandmother, granny”), diminutive of ба́ба (bába, “old woman”).

definitionGroups.group: An old woman, especially one of Eastern European descent.

entries.meaning: (By association) A stereotypical, Eastern European peasant grandmother-type figure.
(Eastern Europe, derogatory, slang) An old woman of Russian or Belarusian descent with unwelcome conservative and/or Orthodox Christian views.
A traditional floral headscarf worn by an Eastern European woman, tied under the chin.
examples: The crowd falls silent, momentarily stunned, while a heavyset woman in a babushka pushes her way through, broadcasting the news […].
